intro: Acronia pansamalae, commonly known as the Panamá morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and trumpet-like, colorful flowers that bloom in the early morning. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in humid forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
